data.title: TV marathon for Totò: his best films for a whole day
data.meta_description: For the 50 years since the death of the prince of laughter, the Iris channel will broadcast a marathon, called "Totò per semper", of his most iconic films.
data.text:
The Iris channel dedicates to the prince of laughter a TV marathon entitled "Totò per semper" for the 50 years since his death.

The events in Naples for the commemoration of the 50 years of Totò's death will be multiple: exhibitions, concerts, exhibitions, artistic installations and even the dedication of a special coin.

The Iris TV channel (22 channel of the digital terrestrial) fits into this rich programming transmitting the 15 April 2017 a marathon, called "Totò forever”, Of all the most iconic films of Antonio De Curtis. It will start at 9:00 with “The three thieves” and will end the schedule at 3:00 with Totò D'Arabia.

Within the programming they have not been chosen only comedy movies, although Totò is considered unanimously on a par with top-level actors such as Buster Keaton and Charlie Chaplin, but also more dramatic and mirroring films of the times, such as “Uccellini ed Uccellacci” by Pier Paolo Pasolini.

Following the programming.

Movie hours

09.00 hours The three thieves

by Lionello De Felice, with Giovanna Ralli, Jean-Claude Pascal, Gino Bramieri, Bice Valori

11.00 hours Arrangiatevi!

by Mauro Bolognini, with Peppino De Filippo

13.00 hours Totò against Maciste

by Fernando Cerchio, with Samson Burke, Nino Taranto

hours 15.00 Totò, Peppino and ... the sweet life

by Sergio Corbucci, with Peppino De Filippo

hours 17.00 Totò and Peppino divided in Berlin

by Giorgio Bianchi, with Peppino De Filippo

19.00 hours Uccellacci and birds

by Pier Paolo Pasolini, with Ninetto Davoli, Femi Benussi

21.00 hours I 2 marshals

by Sergio Corbucci, with Vittorio De Sica, Gianni Agus

23.00 hours Triple bed

di Steno, with Peppino De Filippo, Aroldo Tieri

01.00 hours What happened to Toto baby?

by Ottavio Alessi, with Pietro De Vico

03.00 hours Totò of Arabia

by José Antonio de la Loma, with Nieves Navarro
